snippet: Speaker John A. Boehner’s offer to President Obama to allow some tax rates to rise has changed the negotiations to avert a fiscal crisis in January.
abstract: Speaker John A. Boehner’s offer to President Obama to allow some tax rates to rise has changed the negotiations to avert a fiscal crisis in January.

byline.original: By JONATHAN WEISMAN AND JACKIE CALMES

lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Speaker John A. Boehner’s latest offer to President Obama to allow tax rates to rise on incomes over $1 million has already changed the terms of negotiations to avert a fiscal crisis in January, and both sides on Sunday expressed new optimism that a deal could be reached this week.

headline.main: Speaker’s Overture on Taxes Raises Hope for Fiscal Deal
